content: GOA, India, May 5 (Reuters) - Pakistan's foreign minister on Friday said India's decision to end the special status of Jammu &amp; Kashmir territory in 2019 has undermined the environment for holding Pakistan-India talks.

The onus was on India to create a conducive environment for talks, Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari told reporters on the sidelines of a meeting of regional bloc Shanghai Cooperation Organisation in the Indian state of Goa. (Reporting by Gibran Peshimam; Writing by Shivam Patel; Editing by Toby Chopra)
